meanings.definition: To have or retain possession of
meanings.sent1: I will keep this toy safe.
meanings.sent2: Please keep the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: I will keep the secret like a treasure.
meanings.sent4: She keeps her memories locked away.
meanings.sent5: Keep your keys in a secure place.

meanings.definition: To continue in a specified state, condition, or position
meanings.sent1: He will keep running until he reaches the finish line.
meanings.sent2: Keep the door closed to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: The clock decided to keep ticking all night.
meanings.sent4: Her heart kept beating with excitement.
meanings.sent5: Keep the music playing for a joyful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To provide for the sustenance of
meanings.sent1: We need to keep the plants watered.
meanings.sent2: Keep the pets fed and happy.
meanings.sent3: The chef will keep the guests well-fed.
meanings.sent4: She keeps her family nourished with love.
meanings.sent5: Keep the birds well-fed with seeds.

meanings.definition: To remain in a specified place
meanings.sent1: The cat likes to keep under the bed.
meanings.sent2: Keep your shoes by the door.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to keep in the tree all day.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest keeps hidden in the cave.
meanings.sent5: Keep the umbrella in the stand by the door.

meanings.definition: To fulfill or observe (a promise, agreement, or requirement)
meanings.sent1: I promise to keep my word.
meanings.sent2: Keep your appointment with the doctor.
meanings.sent3: She will keep her end of the bargain.
meanings.sent4: The team keeps their commitment to excellence.
meanings.sent5: Keep the promise you made to yourself.
